intro: Gymnanthes nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined gymnanthes, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with prominent venation. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Gymnanthes nervosa is often found in moist, tropical environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
